parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2
Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.STUDYID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Although this field is not typically captured on a CRF, it should be displayed clearly on the CRF and/or in the EDC system. This field can be included in the database or populated during SDTM- based dataset creation before submission.
fields.label: Study Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: STUDYID
fields.questionText: What is the study identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.SITEID

fields.definition: A unique identifier for a site within a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically pre-printed in the header of each CRF page for single-site studies. For studies with multiple sites, this field may be left blank so that the number can be recorded by the site, or it may be pre-printed on the CRFs that are shipped to each site. \n EDC: This should be pre-populated.
fields.label: Study Site Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SITEID
fields.questionText: What is the site identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.SUBJID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the identifier for the subject.
fields.definition: A unique subject identifier within a site and a study.
fields.implementationNotes: Paper: This is typically recorded in the header of each CRF page. EDC: The subject identifiers may be system-generated. This CDASH variable is typically collected in all CDASH domains. However, this CDASH variable is populated only in the SDTMIG DM domain. For more information, refer to the SDTMIG.
fields.label: Subject Identifier for the Study
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: SUBJID
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the (study) [subject/participant] identifier?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.VISIT

fields.definition: The name of a clinical encounter that encompasses planned and unplanned trial interventions, procedures, and assessments that may be performed on a subject.
fields.implementationNotes: The name of the clinical encounter is typically pre-printed on the CRF or displayed within the EDC for any visit-based data collection, most often in Findings domains. This Visit text description is then available in any EDC data extract for that Findings domain.
fields.label: Visit Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: VISIT
fields.questionText: What is the visit name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.VISDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the [date/start date] of the visit using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: Date the clinical encounter occurred (or started).
fields.implementationNotes: The date the microscopic findings specimens were collected can be determined from the visit date variable (VISDAT) and applying that date to all of the microscopic findings at that visit, or the collection date can be included on the MI CRF using the date (MIDAT) field.
fields.label: Visit Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This field is not an SDTM variable. The date of a measurement, test, observation, or specimen collection can be determined from the date/time of visit (VISDAT/VISTIM) and then concatenating the CDASH VISDAT/VISTIM components and populating the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: VISDAT
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the date of the visit?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIPERF

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether or not microscopic examination was performed.
fields.definition: An indication of whether a planned microbiology measurement, series of microbiology measurements, test, or observation was performed or specimens collected.
fields.implementationNotes: This may be implemented for an entire panel. This general prompt question is used as a data management tool to verify that missing results are confirmed missing.
fields.label: Microscopic Examination Performed
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. May be used to derive a value into the SDTM variable MISTAT. If MIPERF="N", the value of MISTAT will be "NOT DONE". If MIPERF="Y", MISTAT should be null. A combination of SDTMIG variables (e.g., MICAT and MISCAT, MITPT ) is used to indicate that multiple tests were not done. In this situation, the SDTMIG variable MITESTCD would be populated as MIALL and an appropriate test name (MITEST) provided. See SDTMIG for additional information.
fields.name: MIPERF
fields.questionText: Was the microscopic examination performed?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIREFID

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen [accession/reference] number assigned.
fields.definition: An internal or external identifier, such as specimen identifier.
fields.implementationNotes: This can be used to reconcile CRF data. May be included for linking back to specimens (e.g., Specimen ID).
fields.label: MI Reference ID
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MIREFID
fields.questionText: What was the (microscopic test) [reference identifier/accession number]?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MISPID

fields.completionInstructions: If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may insert instructions to ensure each record has a unique identifier.
fields.definition: A sponsor-defined identifier. In CDASH, this is typically used for pre-printed or auto-generated numbers on the CRF, or any other type of identifier that does not already have a defined CDASH identifier field.
fields.implementationNotes: Because SPID is a sponsor-defined identifier, conformance to Question Text or Item Prompt is not applicable. Typically used as an identifier in a data query to communicate clearly to the site the specific record in question or to reconcile data. May be used to record preprinted number (e.g. line number, record number) on the CRF. This field may be populated by the sponsor's data collection system.
fields.label: MI Sponsor-Defined Identifier
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. May be used to create RELREC to link this record with a record in another domain.
fields.name: MISPID
fields.questionText: [Sponsor-defined question]

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIDAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the (start) date of specimen collection using this format (DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.definition: The date of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous date format (e.g., DD-MON-YYYY).
fields.implementationNotes: A complete date is expected. The date of specimen collection may be determined from the date of visit (VISDAT) and, if so, a separate assessment date field is not required.
fields.label: Specimen Collection Date
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MIDAT
fields.questionText: What was the (start) date of the specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MITIM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the (start) time of collection (as complete as possible).
fields.definition: The time of specimen collection, represented in an unambiguous time format (e.g., hh:mm:ss).
fields.implementationNotes: May be required when multiple assessments are done on one day or when the timing in relationship to study treatment is required for analysis.
fields.label: Specimen Collection Time
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. For the SDTM submission dataset, concatenate all collected CDASH DATE and TIME components and populate the SDTMIG variable MIDTC in ISO 8601 format.
fields.name: MITIM
fields.questionText: What was the (start) time of the specimen collection?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MICAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microscopic finding category, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A grouping of topic-variable values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading or a pre-printed category value on the CRF, and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Category" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Category for Microscopic Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MICAT
fields.questionText: What was the category of the microscopic finding?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MISCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the microscopic finding subcategory, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: A sub-division of the MICAT values based on user-defined characteristics.
fields.implementationNotes: Sponsor-defined controlled terminology. This would most commonly be either a heading, or a pre-printed category value on the CRF and not a question to which the site would provide an answer. If a question is asked, the response would typically be a sponsor-defined codelist. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Subcategory" can be included as the column header. MISCAT can only be used if there is an MICAT, and it must be a subcategorization of MICAT.
fields.label: Subcategory for Microscopic Finding
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MISCAT
fields.questionText: What was the subcategory of the microscopic finding?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C132262

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MITEST

fields.completionInstructions: Record the type or name of the microscopic examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF. If collected on the CRF, the sponsor may provide additional instructions to ensure the data is entered as intended.
fields.definition: Descriptive name of the microscopic test or examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Required to identify which test the result is for. It is recommended that the test names be pre-printed on the CRF rather than collected in a free-text field. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Microscopic Examination Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column. The SDTMIG variable MITESTCD may be determined from the value collected in MITEST. Both MITESTCD and MITEST are required in the SDTM submission datasets. Use appropriate CDISC Controlled Terminology for the test and test code.
fields.name: MITEST
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the name (of the microscopic [measurement/test/examination])?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C125922

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MITSTDTL

fields.completionInstructions: Record the detail of the microscopic examination, if not pre-printed on the CRF.
fields.definition: Detail of the microscopic examination used to obtain the measurement or finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Provides additional details for the microscopic examination. It is recommended that the test detail be pre-printed on the CRF. If the form is laid out as a grid, then words such as "Test Detail" can be included as the column header.
fields.label: Microscopic Examination Detail
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MITSTDTL
fields.questionText: What [is/was] the [microscopic measurement/test/examination] detail name?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: MI Result or Finding in Original Units

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIORRES

sdtmigDatasetMappingTargets.title: Result or Finding in Original Units

self.title: MI Result or Finding in Original Units

fields.completionInstructions: Record the test result, interpretation, or finding.
fields.definition: Result of the measurement or finding as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Both quantitative results and interpretive findings or summaries may be recorded here.
fields.label: MI Result or Finding in Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIORRES
fields.questionText: What was the result of the examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIORRESU

fields.completionInstructions: Select the original unit in which these data were collected, or record if not pre-printed on CRF.
fields.definition: The unit of the result as originally received or collected.
fields.implementationNotes: Should be pre-printed on the CRF with the associated test when possible, rather than collected in a free-text field. Should be included if applicable and not available elsewhere. For some tests, the units may not be applicable (e.g., reaction score for HER2).
fields.label: MI Original Units
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIORRESU
fields.questionText: What was the unit of the result?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C66742

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MICLSIG

fields.completionInstructions: Indicate whether the results were clinically significant.
fields.definition: An indication of whether the test results were clinically significant.
fields.label: MI Clinical Significance
fields.mappingInstructions: This does not map directly to an SDTMIG variable. This information could be submitted in a SUPPMI dataset as the value of SUPPMI.QVAL where SUPPMI.QNAM="MICLSIG" and SUPPMI.QLABEL="Clinically Significant". Refer to the current SDTM and SDTMIG for instructions on placement of non-standard variables in SDTM domains.
fields.name: MICLSIG
fields.questionText: Was the result clinically significant?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIRESCAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the category of the test results.
fields.definition: Used to categorize the result of a finding.
fields.implementationNotes: Used to categorize the results of a finding (e.g., MALIGNANT or BENIGN, RESISTANCE VARIANT for genetic variation)
fields.label: MI Result Category
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIRESCAT
fields.questionText: What was the result category?

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MINAM

fields.completionInstructions: Record the laboratory name.
fields.definition: The name or identifier of the vendor (e.g., laboratory) that provided the test results.
fields.implementationNotes: Recommended to collect on the CRF if lab name was not collected at the site/study level or if multiple labs are used by a site
fields.label: Laboratory/Vendor Name
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MINAM
fields.questionText: What was the name of the vendor used?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78734

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MISPEC

fields.completionInstructions: Record the specimen material type.
fields.definition: Defines the type of specimen used for a measurement.
fields.implementationNotes: The type of specimen used for a measure. Should be collected if not available elsewhere, or if required to differentiate multiple specimens.
fields.label: MI Specimen Material Type
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MISPEC
fields.questionText: What is the specimen material type?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78733

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MISPCCND

fields.completionInstructions: Record the condition of the specimen.
fields.definition: Describes the condition of the specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be collected using free or standardized text. This can be used when results may be affected by whether conditions for specimen were properly met.
fields.label: MI Specimen Condition
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MISPCCND
fields.questionText: What was the condition of the specimen?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C74456

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MILOC

fields.completionInstructions: Record or select the anatomical location of specimen collection.
fields.definition: A description of the anatomical location of the subject, relevant to the collection of specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: Collected or pre-printed when the sponsor needs to identify the specific anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF. LAT, DIR, and PORTOT are used to further describe the anatomical location.
fields.label: MI Specimen Collection Location
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MILOC
fields.questionText: What was the anatomical location from which the specimen was collected?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99073

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MILAT

fields.completionInstructions: Record the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier for anatomical location, further detailing the side of the body.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the specific side of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MI Specimen Laterality within Subject
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MILAT
fields.questionText: What was the side of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C99074

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIDIR

fields.completionInstructions: Record the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection.
fields.definition: Qualifier further detailing the position of the anatomical location, relative to the center of the body, organ, or specimen.
fields.implementationNotes: May be pre-printed or collected when the sponsor needs to identify the directionality of the anatomical location. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MI Specimen Directionality within Subjct
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIDIR
fields.questionText: What was the directionality of the anatomical location of the specimen collection?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C85492

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

priorVersion.title: MI Method of Test or Examination

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIMETHOD

self.title: MI Method of Test or Examination

fields.completionInstructions: Record the method of test or examination.
fields.definition: Method of the test or examination.
fields.implementationNotes: This information may be collected when more than 1 method is possible, and collecting the method used is necessary. This could include technique or type of staining used for the slides.
fields.label: MI Method of Test or Examination
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIMETHOD
fields.questionText: What was the method used for the test or examination?

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C78735

parentProduct.title: Clinical Data Acquisition Standards Harmonization Implementation Guide for Human Clinical Trials Version 2.2

rootItem.title: Version-agnostic anchor element for scenario field Local Processing.MIEVAL

fields.completionInstructions: Select the role of the person who provided the evaluation (e.g., INVESTIGATOR, ADJUDICATION COMMITTEE, VENDOR).
fields.definition: The role of the person providing the evaluation.
fields.implementationNotes: Used only for results that are subjective (e.g., assigned by a person or a group). May be a pre-printed or collected. Sponsors may collect the data using a subset list of controlled terminology on the CRF.
fields.label: MI Evaluator
fields.mappingInstructions: Maps directly to the SDTMIG variable listed in the SDTMIG Target column.
fields.name: MIEVAL
fields.questionText: Who was the evaluator?
